title: The Hotplate: Christina’s owner Christina Harding on her Perth restaurant |
text:
WHEN you talk to Christina Harding, the owner of one of the restaurants featured on Nine’s The Hotplate, the first thing you have to get used to is the way she talks about her restaurant as if it’s a person.
“I call her the old bird”, Christina told news.com.au of her eponymous restaurant, “She’s the mother ship, she’s been there for 21 years and she’s paid for everything we have, she put the kids through school, she bought us a home, paid for our holidays, she’s paid for the lot.”
The 60-year-old has been operating her restaurant with her daughter Tania, 36, in the Perth suburb of East Victoria Park for 21 years.
It’s a family favourite and a local icon, but in recent times has sadly been overshadowed by newcomers on the block.
“She was the first one (restaurant) in the area, but she’s been pushed to the back and pushed down the line a bit. But this old bird needs to be back at the front, getting herself out there, she’s been fantastic for 21 years and deserves to be out there in the limelight.” Tania Harding Scott Pickett and Christina Harding. Source: News Corp Australia
But admitting her restaurant needed a bit of a spruce up wasn’t easy for Christina to do.
“I respect her, she’s part of the family and she’s been a winner, and for me to accept that she’s getting old and behind the times is really difficult, it was a bit of an insult really. Everyone kept telling me ‘she’s old, let’s get tapas, let’s get this’ and I hated it, I took it personally because she needs to be respected. It was really hard to admit she needed a makeover but it’s true, she did need to be freshened up. We all do as we get older.”
Last night, viewers saw Christina and daughter Tania — who normally works front of house — score 48 out of 90 for their food and dining experience from their fellow teams and judges Scott Pickett and Tom Parker Bowles.
What they also saw was a touch of Christina and Tania’s fiery personalities, which we’re no doubt destined to see more of during the series. Christina and her daughter Tania. Source: Channel 9
“I have been known to be worse than Gordon Ramsay when something is not going right and my customer is not getting the right meal,” Christina said. “I used to go off, I’d go ballistic. I’ve probably toned it down a little now, but I have definitely been known to be volatile in the kitchen. I will defend myself to the hilt because my customer is everything to me.”
Often baring the brunt of Christina’s wrath is her daughter Tania, who has quit working in her mother’s restaurant a fair few times over the years.
“She’s probably quit more than 20 times,” Christina said, “she’s been fired as well as but she keeps coming back.
“We’re probably just too similar. I wanted to kill her and she wanted to kill me, when you work with family, it’s really difficult, they don’t like to take orders, think they know better, but there can only be one boss and one person making decisions.
“But Tania reckons that this show has been like therapy and really cathartic for her, it’s definitely brought us closer together, we’ve begun to talk to each other again.”
The Hotplate airs on Channel 9 again tonight at 7.30. Some of the other contestants on The Hotplate. Source: Channel 9
Originally published as Hotplate’s Christina: ‘I call her the old bird’
